question: A car travels along a straight line for 100 meters in 20 seconds. What is its average velocity?
A particle moves in a circle of radius 5 meters with a constant speed of 10 m/s. What is its centripetal acceleration?
A projectile is fired at an angle of 45° with an initial speed of 20 m/s. What is the time of flight?
A body is projected horizontally with an initial velocity of 10 m/s from the top of a building. How long does it take to hit the ground from a height of 20 meters?
A stone is thrown at an angle of 60° to the horizontal with an initial velocity of 40 m/s. What is the maximum height attained by the stone?
A projectile is thrown with an initial speed of 30 m/s at an angle of 30°. What is the horizontal range?
A body moves in a circle of radius 10 meters with a constant speed of 5 m/s. What is the time period of the motion?
An object moves in a circle with an angular velocity of 5 rad/s. What is the linear velocity if the radius of the circle is 4 meters?
A particle moves with a velocity of 10 m/s along the x-axis. What is the angle of its motion with the horizontal axis?
explanation: Since the particle moves along the x-axis, the angle is \(0^{\circ}\).

question: A body is projected with a velocity of 30 m/s at an angle of 60° to the horizontal. What is the time of flight?
A particle moves in a circle with a constant speed of 10 m/s. If the radius of the circle is 5 meters, what is its centripetal force?
An object moves along a straight line with a uniform acceleration. If its initial velocity is 5 m/s and after 4 seconds, its velocity is 25 m/s, what is the acceleration?
A particle moves in a circle with a radius of 2 meters. If its linear speed is 4 m/s, what is the angular velocity?
A projectile is thrown with a velocity of 20 m/s at an angle of 45°. What is the time of flight?
A body is moving with an initial velocity of 10 m/s along a straight path. What will be its displacement after 5 seconds if it has an acceleration of 2 m/s²?
A body is moving in a circle with a radius of 10 meters. If its velocity is 20 m/s, what is the centripetal acceleration?
A particle moves with a velocity of 12 m/s along the x-axis. What will be its velocity after 3 seconds if it has an acceleration of 2 m/s² along the y-axis?
explanation: The particle is moving along the x-axis, so its velocity along the x-axis does not change.

question: A rock is thrown vertically upward with an initial velocity of 20 m/s. What is its maximum height?
A car moves with a constant acceleration of 2 m/s². If its initial velocity is 10 m/s, what will be its velocity after 5 seconds?
A particle moves with a velocity of 8 m/s along a straight path. If its acceleration is 4 m/s², what will be its velocity after 3 seconds?
A ball is thrown upward with a velocity of 15 m/s. What will be its velocity after 3 seconds?
explanation: Velocity after time \(v = u - g \times t = 15 - 10 \times 3 = 15 - 30 = -15 \text{ m/s}\)

question: A body falls from a height of 20 meters. What is its velocity just before hitting the ground?
A car is moving at a speed of 20 m/s. If the car slows down with an acceleration of 2 m/s², how long will it take to stop?
A ball is thrown horizontally from a height of 10 meters. What is the time it will take to hit the ground?
A particle is moving in a circle with a radius of 3 meters and a speed of 6 m/s. What is the centripetal force acting on the particle?
